discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. schema
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/security-column-intro

"What are masking policies?
Snowflake supports masking policies as a schema-level object to protect sensitive data...."

Selected Answer: B
Masking policies are applied to columns to control how sensitive data is displayed

Selected Answer: C
C is right

questions.question_text: Masking policies are created at what level in Snowflake?

discussion.content:
Type predicates are functions like IS_BOOLEAN, IS_BINARY, etc...
They check the type of values in variants

See https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/functions-semistructured#list-of-semi-structured-and-structured-data-functions

questions.question_text: What are type predicates used for?

choices.A: Extracting data from a VARIANT column
choices.C: Determining if a value in a VARIANT column is a particular data type
choices.D: Manipulating objects and arrays in a VARIANT column
choices.B: Casting a value in a VARIANT column to a particular data type

questions.question_text: Which table function is used to perform additional processing on the results of a previously-run query?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
D & E options are correct.

choices.B: Automatically allocate more storage space to a virtual warehouse.
choices.D: Suspend a virtual warehouse when its credit usage reaches a defined limit.
choices.C: Modify the queries being executed within a virtual warehouse.
choices.E: Trigger a notification to account administrators when credit usage reaches a specified threshold.
choices.A: Monitor the performance of individual queries in real-time.

discussion.content:
